title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: Button types
code: mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars dataset",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data as csv",     button_type = "default",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )

title: Customizing buttons with css
text: Show css code
code: .button_large {   font-size: 24px; } library(downloadthis)  mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars dataset",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data as csv",     button_type = "default",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save",     class = "button_large"   )

title: Customizing buttons with css
text: Show css code
code: .button_times_new_roman {   font-family: "Times New Roman";   font-size: 14px; } library(downloadthis)  mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars dataset",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data as csv",     button_type = "default",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save",     class = "button_times_new_roman"   )

title: Customizing buttons with css
text: Show css code
code: /* from https://ianlunn.github.io/Hover/ */ .hvr-sweep-to-left {   display: inline-block;   vertical-align: middle;   -webkit-transform: perspective(1px) translateZ(0);   transform: perspective(1px) translateZ(0);   box-shadow: 0 0 1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);   position: relative;   -webkit-transition-property: color;   transition-property: color;   -webkit-transition-duration: 0.3s;   transition-duration: 0.3s; } .hvr-sweep-to-left:before {   content: "";   position: absolute;   z-index: -1;   top: 0;   left: 0;   right: 0;   bottom: 0;   background: #2098D1;   -webkit-transform: scaleX(0);   transform: scaleX(0);   -webkit-transform-origin: 100% 50%;   transform-origin: 100% 50%;   -webkit-transition-property: transform;   transition-property: transform;   -webkit-transition-duration: 0.3s;   transition-duration: 0.3s;   -webkit-transition-timing-function: ease-out;   transition-timing-function: ease-out; } .hvr-sweep-to-left:hover, .hvr-sweep-to-left:focus, .hvr-sweep-to-left:active {   color: white; } .hvr-sweep-to-left:hover:before, .hvr-sweep-to-left:focus:before, .hvr-sweep-to-left:active:before {   -webkit-transform: scaleX(1);   transform: scaleX(1); } library(downloadthis)  mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars dataset",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data as csv",     button_type = "default",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save",     class = "hvr-sweep-to-left"   )

what: Passing a data frame to the function
title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: library(downloadthis)  mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars dataset",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data as csv",     button_type = "default",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )

what: Passing a list with data frames to the function
title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: list(mtcars, iris) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars and iris datasets",     output_extension = ".xlsx",     button_label = "Download datasets as xlsx",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )

what: Passing a named list with data frames to the function
title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: list("mtcars dataset" = mtcars, "iris dataset" = iris) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars and iris datasets",     output_extension = ".xlsx",     button_label = "Download datasets as xlsx",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )

title: Introduction to  downloadthis
text: case want make R object available download, may use .rds extension.
code: vector_example <- 1:10 linear_model <- lm(mpg ~ gear, data = mtcars)  list(mtcars, iris, vector_example, linear_model) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "datasets, vector, and linear model",     output_extension = ".rds",     button_label = "Download as rds",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )

title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: ## Link in Github repo download_link(   link = "https://github.com/fmmattioni/downloadthis/raw/master/inst/example/file_1.pdf",   button_label = "Download pdf file",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: download_file(   path = system.file("assets/css/all.min.css", package = "downloadthis"),   output_name = "CSS file from downloadthis",   button_label = "Download css file",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: path_files <- list.files(path = system.file("assets/css", package = "downloadthis"), full.names = TRUE)  download_file(   path = path_files,   output_name = "Files from downloadthis",   button_label = "Download files",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: download_dir(   path = system.file("assets", package = "downloadthis"),   output_name = "example dir",   button_label = "Download directory",   button_type = "success",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Introduction to  downloadthis
code: library(ggplot2)  plot <- ggplot(cars, aes(speed, dist)) +   geom_point()  plot download_this(plot) #> Saving 7.29 x 4.51 in image

title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
text: goal downloadthis implement download buttons HTML output RMarkdown without need runtime:shiny.

title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
text: can install released version downloadthis CRAN : can install development version downloadthis GitHub :
code: install.packages("downloadthis") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("fmmattioni/downloadthis")

title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
text: package builds download button R Markdown using bsplus, inspired post Yihui Xie. ✅ downloadthis now uses font-awesome icons v.5.13.0

what: Data frames, lists, or any R object
title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
code: library(downloadthis)  mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars data set",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   ) vector_example <- 1:10 linear_model <- lm(mpg ~ gear, data = mtcars)  list(mtcars, iris, vector_example, linear_model) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "datasets, vector, and linear model",     output_extension = ".rds",     button_label = "Download as rds",     button_type = "success",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )

title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
code: ## Link in Github repo download_link(   link = "https://github.com/fmmattioni/downloadthis/raw/master/inst/example/file_1.pdf",   button_label = "Download pdf file",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
code: ## One file example download_file(   path = system.file("assets/css/all.min.css", package = "downloadthis"),   output_name = "CSS file from downloadthis",   button_label = "Download css file",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Implement Download Buttons in rmarkdown
code: ## Directory path as an example download_dir(   path = system.file("assets", package = "downloadthis"),   output_name = "example dir",   button_label = "Download directory",   button_type = "success",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )

title: Download a directory — download_dir
text: path converted .zip file.

title: Download a directory — download_dir
code: download_dir(   path,   output_name,   button_label = "Download data",   button_type = c("default", "primary", "success", "info", "warning", "danger"),   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE,   ... )

title: Download a directory — download_dir
text: path Path directory. output_name Name output file. button_label Character (HTML), button label button_type Character, one standard Bootstrap types has_icon Specify whether include fontawesome icons button label icon Fontawesome tag e.g.: "fa fa-save" self_contained boolean specify whether HTML output self-contained. Default FALSE. ... attributes (named arguments) children (unnamed arguments) button, passed htmltools::tag().

title: Download a directory — download_dir
text: htmltools::tag, <button>

title: Download a directory — download_dir
code: if (FALSE) { ## Directory path as an example download_dir(   path = system.file("assets", package = "downloadthis"),   output_name = "example dir",   button_label = "Download directory",   button_type = "success",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE ) }

what: Download a local file or multiple files — download_file
title: Download a local file or multiple files — download_file
text: case multiple files chosen, files converted .zip file.

title: Download a local file or multiple files — download_file
code: download_file(   path,   output_name,   button_label = "Download data",   button_type = c("default", "primary", "success", "info", "warning", "danger"),   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE,   ... )

title: Download a local file or multiple files — download_file
text: path Path file(s). multiple files chosen, vector must passed argument. output_name Name output file. specified, take source file's name one file specified. case multiple files, output_name must specified. button_label Character (HTML), button label button_type Character, one standard Bootstrap types has_icon Specify whether include fontawesome icons button label icon Fontawesome tag e.g.: "fa fa-save" self_contained boolean specify whether HTML output self-contained. Default FALSE. ... attributes (named arguments) children (unnamed arguments) button, passed htmltools::tag().

title: Download a local file or multiple files — download_file
text: htmltools::tag, <button>

title: Download a local file or multiple files — download_file
code: if (FALSE) { ## One file example download_file(   path = system.file("assets/css/all.min.css", package = "downloadthis"),   output_name = "CSS file from downloadthis",   button_label = "Download css file",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE )  ## Multiple files example path_files <- list.files(   path = system.file("assets/css", package = "downloadthis"),   full.names = TRUE )  download_file(   path = path_files,   output_name = "Files from downloadthis",   button_label = "Download files",   button_type = "danger",   has_icon = TRUE,   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE ) }

what: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
title: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
text: Wrapper around bsplus::bs_button() provide download button HTML outputs R Markdown. Internally, function writes file tempdir(), encodes , produces download button. Currently, Internet Explorer support downloading embedded files. downloading links, files, directories, see download_link(), download_file(), download_dir().

title: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
code: download_this(   .data,   ...,   output_name = NULL,   output_extension = c(".csv", ".xlsx", ".rds"),   button_label = "Download data",   button_type = c("default", "primary", "success", "info", "warning", "danger"),   icon = "fa fa-save",   self_contained = FALSE,   csv2 = TRUE,   ggsave_args = list() )

title: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
text: .data data frame (named) list write disk. See 'Examples' details. ... attributes (named arguments) children (unnamed arguments) button, passed htmltools::tag(). output_name Name output file, NULL uses deparsed .data object. output_extension Extension output file. Currently,  .csv, .xlsx, .rds supported. (named) list passed function, .xlsx .rds supported. button_label Character (HTML), button label button_type Character, one standard Bootstrap types icon Fontawesome tag e.g.: "fa fa-save", set NULL self_contained boolean specify whether HTML output self-contained. Default FALSE. csv2 boolean specify whether use readr::write_csv2() case output_extension chosen '.csv'. FALSE, readr::write_csv() used instead. Default TRUE. ggsave_args List arguments pass ggplot2::ggsave, e.g.: list(height = 5).

title: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
text: htmltools::tag, <button>

title: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
text: example write mtcars dataset tempdir() produce download button file mtcars dataset.csv fa fa-save icon Download data label.

title: Download data frames, lists, or any R object — download_this
code: if (FALSE) { # Passing a data frame to the function mtcars %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars dataset",     output_extension = ".csv",     button_label = "Download data",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )  # Passing a list with data frames to the function list(mtcars, iris) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars and iris datasets",     output_extension = ".xlsx",     button_label = "Download data",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )  # Passing a named list with data frames to the function list("mtcars dataset" = mtcars, "iris dataset" = iris) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "mtcars and iris datasets",     output_extension = ".xlsx",     button_label = "Download data",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   )  # Passing any R object to the function vector_example <- 1:10 linear_model <- lm(mpg ~ gear, data = mtcars)  list(mtcars, iris, vector_example, linear_model) %>%   download_this(     output_name = "datasets, vector, and linear model",     output_extension = ".rds",     button_label = "Download as rds",     button_type = "warning",     has_icon = TRUE,     icon = "fa fa-save"   ) }

code: lhs %>% rhs

title: downloadthis 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-04 Implemented use blobs. Removed warning readr package (#17).

title: downloadthis 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-17 Added method download ggplot2 object (#7). Thanks @JohnCoene. Now output_name optional, thanks @JohnCoene. Added option choose readr::write_csv() readr::write_csv2() output extension ‘.csv’ download_this() (#3)

title: downloadthis 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-04 Removed rmarkdown dependency moved ‘Suggests’. Font-awesome dependency now correctly added head tag (Thanks @AmitLevinson). Added self_contained option. Removed purrr dependency. Added .rds support - now R object can used downloading .rds file. Added download_link(), download_file(), download_dir() downloading web links, local file(s) directory.

title: downloadthis 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-14 Fixed bug fontawesome dependency correctly added HTML output. Now fontawesome icons external, makes HTML output file much lighter.

title: downloadthis 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-30 Fixed warning checking list inputs. Now .csv export option uses readr::read_csv2(). Added details documentation.

title: downloadthis 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-05 Now possible pass list (named) data frames function written separate sheets ‘.xlsx’. Created vignette show download button can customized. Updated vignettes.

title: downloadthis 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-25 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added fontawesome icons button label.
